get.summary: Get lineage information from a MAM address
get.description:
Get lineage information from a MAM address. 
 To improve the performance, it always check the cache before query the tangle.Data is cached for two days by default.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: MAM address that contains data lineage information

parameters.name: all
parameters.description:
Optional, determine if the API should return the whole data lineage. 
 If "all" is provided, it loads the data lineage information from the specified address, **plus** it loads all upper stream address information **recursively** from inputs field. 
 If "all" is ignored, it **only** loads data lineage information from the specified MAM address. It is a "lazy load" that does not load information from inputs field.

200.description: successful loaded the information from the specified address

404.description: Information is not found from the address

get.description: Get all data lineage information from channel, by specifying the start root address in that channel

200.description: Successfully loaded packages from the channel

post.summary: Send the data lineage information to the tangle
post.description:
Send the data lineage information to the tangles. It writes a json object into a MAM message and stores in the channel. 
 If a channel from the seed already exists, the new message will be inserted into the channel, and linked to the last existing message. 
 If it is a new seed, a new channel will be created.
As IOTA MAM SDK doesn't support for directly getting the last available address from the channel, the api locate the last address by scanning on the message chain in the channel. Then the API cache the mam status and last address for next submit.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: In order to write into a channel, we must provide the private seed of that channel. If it is a new seed, a new channel will be created.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
The data lineage format, it is either 'lightweight' or 'standard'. 
 **lightweight**: the value (data package content) will be saved as clear text in MAM message. 
 **standard**: In stead of saving the clear text data content, a hash value will be stored  in the MAM message. The hash value is computed as sha256(packageId, value, timestamp).

dataPackageId.description: Optional. The id of the data package, if not provided, the server side generates a GUID for it

value.description: Mandatory, the content of the data package.

items.description: Optional. The address of the package which are the input to the current package

ownerMetadata.description: Optional, the information about the data source. It will be shown on the data lineage viewer diagram

operation.description: Optional, the information about what kind of operation was done, based on the inputs. It will be shown on the data lineage viewer diagram

200.description:
If the data was submitted to the tangle is successfully. A json object is created, stored in a MAM message in the channel and returned. 
 The json object contains the following fields: 
 - mamAddress: the address that stores this message. 
 - nextRootAddress: the next available address in the channel. 
 - timestamp: server side timestamp. 
 - data/signature: based on the format, either 'data' or 'signature' will be created and stored in the MAM message. 
 -- lightweight format: field name = 'data', value = Data package content in clear text. 
 -- standard format: field name = 'signature', value = Hash of several fields from the request. The hash value is computed on the server side. 
 - and, copy of all fields (except 'value' field) from request. 

 If submit failed, an empty result will be returned.

mamAddress.description: MAM address of the submitted data

nextRootAddress.description: The next MAM address in the channel

data.description: data package content in clear text, when it is using lightweight format

signature.description: hash, based on the request, when it is using standard format

dataPackageId.description: specified id from request, or generated by server side

items.description: The address of the package which are the input to the current package

post.description: Publish data lineage information into tangle. It verifies the schema, then publish to tangle without any modification.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: In order to write into a channel, we must provide the private seed of that channel. If it is a new seed, a new channel will be created.

200.description: The data lineage info was published successfully.

400.description: The data lineage info object has an invalid schema.

500.description: Publish failed due to internal error.

datapackageId.description: Data package ID. This ID will be used for querying the data lineage info from the channel. Data source decides the ID format, such as integer or GUID. Different channels can have the same package ID.

wayOfProof.description: This field describes how to verify the integrity based on valueOfProof. For example, it explains the used hash algorithms (SHA1 or SHA2 or others), or it simply copied the data package content into field valueOfProof.

valueOfProof.description: The value of the proof, such as hash value, or the copy of the data content in clear text.

items.description: The current package might have inputs. If yes, all input package addresses are provided in an array.

mamAddress.description: MAM address of the submitted data

nextRootAddress.description: The next MAM address in the channel
